business.headline: Budget 2025: Key proposals for FDs, and long-term savingsTax incentives for fixed deposits and boost middle-class savings could redefine savings strategies in Budget 2025.

Budget 2025: 5 reforms that could make new tax regime a better deal for youThe government is expected to focus on boosting consumption, given the low GDP for the second quarter, which could lead to tax relief measures aimed at increasing disposable income for salaried taxpayers.
Budget 2025: Date, time, and what to expectThe countdown to India's Union Budget 2025 has begun, with Nirmala Sitharaman set to present key policies and reforms on February 1.

Tata Motors share price rises 4%. Is it a good time to invest?Tata Motors stock: Over the past five trading sessions, Tata Motors has gained more than 6%. However, the stock has seen a decline of 18.36% in the last six months.

ITI share price soars over 12%, hits all-time high. Know whyITI stock price: Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.

Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.

Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.

5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatilityThe downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.

Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO: Check price band, GMP today  Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO last day: The initial public offering (IPO) of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices will close for bidding on Friday after having opened for subscription on January 1, 2025.

Sensex drops 400 points; Nifty slips below 24,100 in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.

Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm IPO allotment status:: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.

Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: No Bumrah, no joy: India drop Border-Gavaskar Trophy after 7 years in SydneyA Jasprit Bumrah-less Indian team failed to restrict Australia on Day 3 of the final Test match in Sydney. India lost the 5th Test by 6 wickets, surrendering the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in 10 years.
6 flights cancelled, over 100 delayed in Delhi amid dense fog; trains also hitAs dense fog engulfed Delhi, reducing visibility to zero, at least 6 flights were cancelled today.

How are Congress and BJP different? Rahul Gandhi respondsIn a conversation with IIT Madras students, Rahul Gandhi said the Congress believed in equitable distribution of resources and inclusive growth, while the BJP focused aggressively on growth.

4 Naxals gunned down in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh, cop diesThe gunfight broke out in the densely forested Naxal stronghold Abujhmaad, bordering Narayanpur and Dantewada districts, as the security forces were conducting an anti-Naxalite operation.

India fail to reach World Test Championship final for first time in history Border-Gavaskar Trophy: India failed to reach the final of the World Test Championship for the first time in the tournament's history. Australia will take on South Africa at the Lord's in June in the much-awaited title clash.

Coldplay receives legal notice ahead of Ahmedabad concertAhead of Coldplay's concert in Ahmedabad this January, the District Child Protection Unit has issued a notice to ensure no children are used on stage and mandatory hearing protection is provided.

Hamas releases Israeli teen hostage's video, family says 'hearts torn to pieces'Hamas released a new video of Liri Albag, a 19-year-old Israeli soldier, held hostage for one-and-a-half years by the group. Her family said their "hearts were torn to pieces" after seeing the clip and urged the Israeli government to secure her release.

Situation in China not unusual: Health Ministry urges calm amid HMPV spread scareThe Health Ministry highlighted that India's robust surveillance systems and healthcare resources are well-equipped to handle respiratory illnesses, including those caused by the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV).

Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Bono among 19 to get US's highest civilian honourIn a ceremony at the White House, President Joe Biden awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom to 19 notable figures, including Hillary Clinton and Denzel Washington. The event celebrated contributions to various fields, from politics to entertainment and science.

Rohit Sharma interview triggers meme fest: Einstein, Da Vinci parodies add to funRohit Sharma was the subject of massive trolling by parody accounts after his Sydney interview on Day 2 of the SCG Test on Saturday, January 4. Rohit spoke about a lot of topics during his interview with the broadcasters.

PM to inaugurate Delhi section of Namo Bharat corridor, traffic advisory issuedThe 13-kilometre Delhi section of the Namo Bharat corridor between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday, January 5.

2 men, including ex-Armyman, killed woman, newborn twins; arrested after 19 yearsAfter being on the run for 19 years, the CBI arrested two accused, including a former Armyman, for the brutal murder of a 24-year-old woman and her newborn twin daughters, aged 17 days, in Kerala's Kollam district in 2006.

Pat Cummins walks the talk, adds Border Gavaskar Trophy to glittering cabinetAustralia captain Pat Cummins ended Australia's ten-year-long wait for the Border Gavaskar Trophy as he led them to their first series win since 2015 by 3-1. Cummins picked 25 wickets and scored 159 runs in the series.

Princes William and Harry's ex-nanny's stepson among New Orleans attack victimsPrince William and his wife, Catherine, have expressed their deep sorrow following the death of Edward Pettifer, a 31-year-old British man with close ties to the royal family, in a New Year's Day terror attack in New Orleans.

Chhattisgarh journalist's murder: Key accused, his cousin, arrestedMukesh Chandrakar, a 28-year-old journalist known for his hard-hitting investigative reports, recently exposed alleged corruption in a Rs 120-crore road construction project. He was found dead in a property belonging to Suresh Chandrakar, who was named in the corruption report.

5th Test Day 3 Highlights: Australia win series by 3-1 with 6-wicket victory in SydneyAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND), 5th Test Day 3 Highlights: Australia have beaten India by six wickets in the fifth Test in Sydney and have won the Border Gavaskar Trophy by 3-1 after a long gap of ten years. Travis Head and Beau Webster took Australia home with their unbeaten 58-run stand.

Yuzvendra Chahal shares cryptic post amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree VermaYuzvendra Chahal's cryptic Instagram post amid swirling divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma has left fans speculating. The once-adored couple, who married in 2020, now face reports of separation.

Mitchell Starc eyes Glenn McGrath, Wasim Akram's feat in legendary listBorder Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: Mitchell Starc is on the verge of becoming only the third Australian speedster after Glenn McGrath and Brett Lee to reach the landmark of 700 wickets in international cricket.

Rahmat Shah's 139 leads Afghanistan's recovery vs Zimbabwe in 2nd TestRahmat Shah's gritty 139 and Ismat Alam's unbeaten 64 powered Afghanistan to a commanding position on Day 3 against Zimbabwe. Their 132-run partnership turned the tide, leaving the visitors with a 205-run lead before rain halted play.

Barcelona lose request to keep playing Dani Olmo and Pau VictorDani Olmo and Pau Victor won't play for Barcelona in the second half of the season in the LaLiga. The Spanish football federation and LaLiga, in a joint statement, rejected the request.

AUS vs IND 5th Test: How will rain and pitch impact Day 3 proceedings in SydneyThe Sydney pitch continues to test batters with uneven bounce and seam movement. As Day 3 unfolds, India's lead of 145 looms large, with a target above 200 likely to challenge Australia on this tricky surface.

Devajit Saikia likely to be elected unopposed as BCCI secretaryDevajit Saikia submitted his nomination for the position of BCCI secretary on Saturday, while Prabhtej Bhatia filed his application for the treasurer role. Both officials are the sole candidates for their respective positions.

Sydney pitch not ideal for Test cricket: Sunil GavaskarFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the green pitch in the ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground is not ideal for playing international red-ball cricket. After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two saw an additional 15 wickets tumble. India, having bowled out Australia for 181, took a slender four-run first-innings lead and reached 141/6 at stumps, extending their overall lead to 145.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
